responses.chain_cause: Andy
Andy caused the fence to break.
responses.chain_fault: I guess both of them are sort of at fault. Andy for not paying closer attention to the fence and Suzy. And Suzy for not getting out of the way. However, I think Andy is most at fault because Suzy is technically a pedestrian in this situation and Andy is running a machine (aka bike).
responses.chain_punishment: No one should be punished because it seems accidentally and not intentional.

responses.chain_cause: Andy running into Suzy
Suzy, but not her fault.
responses.chain_punishment: No, this was an accident. Andy's chain broke and Suzy got sent into a fence, It happens.

responses.chain_cause: it all started with andy's bike slipping causing susy to move back and break the fence, ultimately susy broke the fence.
responses.chain_fault: Andy's chain slipped while on his bike causing susy to move back and hit the fence, it all started with andy so it could be Andy's fault.
responses.chain_simple: susy broke the fence by trying to move away from andy's bike.
responses.chain_punishment: Andy started these chain of events, the fault must be of him and his bike which caused susy to move back and break the fence.

responses.chain_cause: Andy knocked Suzy into the fence after his bike chain broke. It was unavoidable.
responses.chain_fault: It was an accident caused by the broken bike chain.
responses.chain_simple: Andy knocked Suzy into the fence by accident.
responses.chain_punishment: They sould not be punished because it was an accident. They need to notify the owner of the fence that it is broken.

responses.chain_cause: Andy, the boy in the bike
The fence broke because Suzy fell into it after being accidentally hit by Andy, who was on a bicycle that suddenly broke.
responses.chain_fault: It is really no one's fault that the fence broke. It was simply an accident.
responses.chain_simple: Suzy technically broke the fence but only because Andy's broken bike hit her and pushed her into the fence.
responses.chain_punishment: No one should be punished. This was an accident that could not be helped.

responses.chain_cause: Andy as he caused Suzy to fall
responses.chain_simple: Andy broke the fence. Suzy wouldn't have fallen without his involvement
responses.chain_punishment: Andy as he intentionally hit Suzy with his bicycle

responses.chain_cause: Andy
responses.chain_punishment: Nah, nobody got hurt, and that is the most important thing to me.  If anything, the boy could do some chores for the owner of the fence perhaps.  Do some errands an offer to repair the fence he caused to break

responses.chain_cause: Andy caused it to break.
responses.chain_fault: It is Andy's fault. He ran into Susie.

responses.chain_cause: Andy
While Suzy's direct contact with the fence WAS the cause for the fence breaking, it was through no FAULT of her own - as this was intentionally caused by the boy on the bicycle.
responses.chain_fault: The boy on the bicycle is 100% at fault for causing the fence to be broken.
responses.chain_simple: Suzy did indeed physically break the fence, as she was the only one to come into contact with it, but she is not to blame for the fence being broken, as this was intentionally caused by the boy on the bicycle. So, yes, she broke it; but she is not at fault.
responses.chain_punishment: The boy on the bicycle should definitely be punished for his actions.

responses.chain_punishment: Andy should be punished because he caused the accident to happen in the first place.
